alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 16 at 10:53AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from last night is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Kansas, including the following county, Cheyenne. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1049 AM CDT, emergency management reported that the Hackberry Creek was out of its banks north of St. Francis. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Cheyenne County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous during flooding. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
